analysis.raw_content:
I can extract the following information from this page of the city planning technical manual:

## Figure 21: Plan view showing how to determine average grade

**Text content:**
"When measuring daylight plane, height is measured from the average of the grade at the midpoint of the building and the grade of the closest point on the abutting site."

**Diagram elements:**
- Shows three property sections with "Rear yard," "Front yard" areas
- Contains "Subject House" in center section
- Shows "Neighbor" properties on left and right
- Displays "Buildable area" zones
- Includes measurement points and grade lines
- Shows required setbacks with dashed lines

**Key/Legend:**
- Lot line (solid line)
- Required setbacks (dashed line)
- Sidewalk (hatched pattern)
- Buildable area (dotted pattern)
- Existing house (solid gray)

## Figure 22: Detail showing allowable eave protrusion

**Technical specifications:**
- Shows "2' max." measurement for eave protrusion
- Indicates "wall plane" 
- States "The daylight plane must clear the point where the wall plane intersects the top of the roof material"

## Certification of daylight plane compliance:

"Upon request by the building official any person building or making improvements to a structure shall provide a certification that the structure, as built, complies with the daylight plane provisions in Code Section 18.12.040(a). Such certification shall be prepared by a licensed engineer, architect, or surveyor, and shall be provided prior to frame inspection. (Sections 18.12.040(j))."

**Page number:** 27
